TypeSignature.Value: .class public interface auto ansi abstract IWithLoadBalancingRule

Docs.summary: The stage of a load balancer definition allowing to create a load balancing rule.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance class Microsoft.Azure.Management.Network.Fluent.LoadBalancingRule.Definition.IBlank`1<class Microsoft.Azure.Management.Network.Fluent.LoadBalancer.Definition.IWithLoadBalancingRuleOrCreate> DefineLoadBalancingRule(string name) cil managed

Docs.param: The name of the load balancing rule.
Docs.summary: Begins the definition of a new load balancing rule to add to the load balancer. The definition must be completed with a call to LoadBalancingRule.DefinitionStages.WithAttach.attach().
Docs.return: The first stage of the new load balancing rule definition.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance class Microsoft.Azure.Management.Network.Fluent.LoadBalancer.Definition.IWithLoadBalancingRuleOrCreate WithLoadBalancingRule(int32 port, class Microsoft.Azure.Management.Network.Fluent.Models.TransportProtocol protocol) cil managed

Docs.param: The port number on the front and back end for the network traffic to be load balanced on.
Docs.summary: Creates a load balancing rule for the specified port and protocol and default frontend and backend associations. The load balancing rule will created under the name "default". It will reference a backend, a frontend, and a load balancing probe all named "default".
Docs.return: The next stage of the definition.

MemberSignature.Value: public Microsoft.Azure.Management.Network.Fluent.LoadBalancer.Definition.IWithLoadBalancingRuleOrCreate WithLoadBalancingRule (int frontendPort, Microsoft.Azure.Management.Network.Fluent.Models.TransportProtocol protocol, int backendPort);

.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance class Microsoft.Azure.Management.Network.Fluent.LoadBalancer.Definition.IWithLoadBalancingRuleOrCreate WithLoadBalancingRule(int32 frontendPort, class Microsoft.Azure.Management.Network.Fluent.Models.TransportProtocol protocol, int32 backendPort) cil managed

Docs.param: The port number on the front end to accept incoming traffic on.
The port number on the back end to send load balanced traffic to.
Docs.summary: Creates a load balancing rule between the specified front end and back end ports and protocol. The new rule will be assigned an automatically generated name.
Docs.return: The next stage of the definition.
